alert.note: Alert for Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 2:21PM CST until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Oregon and Shannon. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 PM CST, The Department of Transportation reported that several roads across the warned area remain flooded from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Spring Valley at Highway N, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Rocky Creek at Highway NN, Carr Creek at Highway HH, Big Creek at County Road 390, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323 and Piney Creek at County Road 228. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thayer, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Koshkonong, Montier, Thomasville, Greer, West Eminence, Alley Spring, Teresita, Wilderness, Rover, Round Spring, Couch, Midridge, Akers, Myrtle, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park and Grand Gulf State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
